thread.title: Popple nets shootout winner for midget Wheat Kings
thread.title_full: Popple nets shootout winner for midget Wheat Kings

title: Popple nets shootout winner for midget Wheat Kings
text:
Popple nets shootout winner for midget Wheat Kings By: Uncredited Report Error 
Tate Popple was the only player to score in the shootout as the Brandon Wheat Kings closed out the Manitoba AAA Midget Hockey League’s showcase weekend in Portage la Prairie with a 2-1 win over the Central Plains Capitals on Sunday. 
In other games on Sunday, it was Yellowhead Chiefs 3, Kenora Thistles 2; and Southwest Cougars 5, Norman Northstars 2. 
On Saturday, it was: Chiefs 4, Interlake Lightning 3; Cougars 4, Pembina Valley Hawks 3; 
and Winnipeg Wild 3, Wheat Kings 1. 
Brendan Kokorudz scored in regulation for the Wheat Kings (3-3-0-0), while Josh Petersen stopped 30 shots in regulation and overtime and all three in the shootout 
Tucker Scantlebury had a goal and two helpers, while Reece Jones stopped 35 shots in net for the Chiefs. Riley Vautour had a goal and an assist for Interlake (3-3-0-0). 
Cougars 4 Hawks 3 
McCorrister netted the 
game-winner with 2:42 left in regulation time for the Cougars, who got a goal and an assist from John Patmore. Matthew Thiessen made 46 saves for Pembina Valley (1-6-1-0). 
Wild 3 Wheat Kings 1 
Riley Stotts and Ian Briscoe scored in the first 2:07 of the third period to break a 1-1 tie and put the Wild (6-0-0-1) up for good. Curtis Ireland had the Wheat Kings’ marker. 
» The Brandon Sun
